questions_and_answers.q: When (x<sup>6</sup>y<sup>5</sup>z<sup>3</sup>)<sup>2</sup> is simplified, what is the sum of the exponents?
Each exterior angle of a regular polygon measures 24°. How many sides does the polygon have?
The total amount Edgar paid for a slice of pizza and a tip of exactly 24% was between $2.50 and $3.00. What was the price of the pizza slice?
What is the probability that flipping a fair coin 15 times will yield equal numbers of heads and tails?
What prime number is a factor of every four-digit palindrome?
How many positive integers that contain each of the four digits 3, 4, 5 and 7 exactly once are multiples of 4?
What is the value of `1/(2^2-1) + 1/(3^2-1) + 1/(4^2-1) + 1/(5^2-1) + 1/(6^2-1)?` Express your answer as a common fraction.

What is the median of the data in the stem-and-leaf plot, shown here where 3|9 represents 39?

3| 9 9
4| 0 3 5 6
5| 0 3 7 7 7
6| 8 8 9 9
7| 4 5
A wholesaler mixes cashews, almonds and filberts in the ratio 2:3:4, respectively, by weight. How many pounds of almonds will be needed to make 540 pounds of this mixture?
What is the sum of the odd numbers between 100 and 200?
How many unique, six-character codes can be made using each of the characters A, B, C, 1, 2 and 3 exactly once

This weekend, there is a 30% chance it will rain Saturday and a 40% chance it will rain Sunday. If these are independent events, what is the percent chance it will rain at least one day during this weekend?
Sweet Delights Candy Company has fixed costs of $300. Each pound of candy costs $1 to produce and is sold for $3. How many pounds of candy must be sold so that the company has no profit and no loss?
Bob ran the first 1000 feet of a race in 250 seconds and the other 4000 feet in 750 seconds. What was his average speed, in feet per second, for the entire race?
If n* is defined as the product of all even factors of 2n, for all integers n, where n > 0, what is the value of 11*?

During the first third of the basketball season, Katrina scored an average of 12 points per game. What is the average number of points she must score per game for the remaining two thirds of the season so that her average points scored per game for the entire season is 14 points?
If the positive integers 15, 9, 5, 7 and x have a mean and median that are identical, what is the value of x?
If a and b both are whole numbers greater than 1, and `1/a + 1/(2a) = 1/b`, what is the smallest possible value for b?
What is the value of `sqrt(10)(sqrt(3)+sqrt(10))`? Express your answer to the nearest whole number.
What is the units digit of the product 1 × 3 × 5 × ... × 2015?
What is the greatest possible product of three distinct positive integers that have a sum of 15?

On average, Diane makes 20 deliveries for a restaurant in a six-hour shift. What is the minimum number of people, each making deliveries at the same rate as Diane, needed to make 20 deliveries for the restaurant per hour?
If `x + y = 5` and `x^2 + y^2 = 20`, what is the value of `xy`? Express your answer as a common fraction.
How many rational values of x are not integers and satisfy the following equation: `x^7 – 6x^6 + 5x^5 – 4x^4 + 3x^3 – 2x^2 + 1 = 0`?
If 4n is subtracted from 48 and the difference then is divided by 2n, the result is 10. What is the value of n?
If the mean of the six integers 6, 2, 10, 5, 12 and y is 7, what is the value of y?

The marks on a certain ruler are evenly spaced `1/16` inch apart. The numbers on this ruler are evenly spaced 1 inch apart. How many marks on this ruler are strictly between the 2-inch mark and the 5-inch mark?
If k represents the result when the sum of the first 30 positive odd integers is reduced by 1, what is the sum of the prime factors of k?

Edward is one of six people who each are writing 180 math problems. When he solves every problem, he gets an incorrect answer for 10% of the problems that he wrote and for 5% of the problems written by the others. For what fraction of the problems does Edward get the wrong answer? Express your answer as a common fraction.
What is the value of `(sqrt(8)+sqrt(18))^2`?
What is the sum of all the integer values of x that satisfy the following two conditions: `|x| < 4` and `−x < 2`?

When Colby rolls two fair standard dice, what is the probability that he rolls the same number on both dice or that the sum of the two numbers rolled is divisible by 3? Express your answer as a common fraction.
Circle O has its center at (−4, 1) and a radius of 5 units. What is the sum of the y-coordinates of the two points where circle O intersects the y-axis?

When building a staircase, a builder uses the equation `57x – 95y = 0` to represent the relationship between the height of each step, `y`, and the depth of each step, `x`. What is the slope of the staircase? Express your answer as a common fraction.
The sum of one-fourth and five-eighths is equivalent to what common fraction?
How many integers that contain each of the four digits 3, 5, 7 and 9 exactly once are prime?
What is the remainder when the sum `2015^3 + 2015^2 + 2015^1 + 2015^0` is divided by 5?
What is the greatest common divisor of 4! and 5! ?
A driver switches car insurance companies and saves 15%, which results in a savings of $450. How many dollars does the new insurance policy cost?

In one board game, each player has a unique 4 × 4 grid with squares randomly labeled with each integer from 1 to 16. As the integers 1 to 16 are randomly called, each player puts an “X” in the square containing that integer. The first player with an “X” in all four squares in any row, column or diagonal wins. At most, how many integers must be called to get a winner?
